text: What then shall we say that Abraham, our ancestor according to the flesh, has discovered regarding this matter?

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st> was <st data-num="1344">declared righteous</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> <st data-num="2041" class="">works</st>, he <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> something to <st data-num="2745" class="">boast</st> about—<st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">before</st> <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>.
For what does the scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”

<st data-num="1161">Now</st> to the one who <st data-num="2038" class="">works</st>, his <st data-num="3408" class="">pay</st> is <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3049" class="">credited</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">due</st> to <st data-num="5485" class="">grace</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">due</st> to <st data-num="3783" class="">obligation</st>.<n id="1" />
But to the one who does not work, but believes in the one who declares the ungodly righteous, his faith is credited as righteousness.
So even David himself speaks regarding the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:
“Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven, and whose sins are covered;
blessed is the one against whom the Lord will never count sin.”
Is this blessedness then for the circumcision or also for the uncircumcision? For we say, “faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness.”

<st data-num="4459" class="">How</st> <st data-num="3767" class="">then</st> was it <st data-num="3049" class="">credited</st> to him? <st data-num="1510">Was</st> he <st data-num="4061" class="">circumcised</st> at the time, <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="203">not</st>? No, he was <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4061" class="">circumcised</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="203" class="">uncircumcised</st>!

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> he <st data-num="2983" class="">received</st> the <st data-num="4592" class="">sign</st> of <st data-num="4061" class="">circumcision</st> as a <st data-num="4973" class="">seal</st> of <st data-num="3588" class="">the</st> <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> that he had by <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> <st data-num="1722">while</st> he was still <st data-num="203" class="">uncircumcised</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1519">so that</st> <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> would <st data-num="1510" class="">become</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="3962" class="">father</st> of <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> those who <st data-num="4100" class="">believe</st> but have <st data-num="203" class="">never</st> been <st data-num="203" class="">circumcised</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="1519">that</st> they <st data-num="2532">too</st> could have <st data-num="1343" class="">righteousness</st> <st data-num="3049" class="">credited</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>.
And he is also the father of the circumcised, who are not only circumcised, but who also walk in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham possessed when he was still uncircumcised.
For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants that he would inherit the world was not fulfilled through the law, but through the righteousness that comes by faith.

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> they become <st data-num="2818" class="">heirs</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>, <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> is <st data-num="2758" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="1860" class="">promise</st> is <st data-num="2673" class="">nullified</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> <st data-num="2716" class="">brings</st> <st data-num="3709" class="">wrath</st>, <st data-num="1161">because</st> <st data-num="3757" class="">where</st> there <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3756">no</st> <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st> there <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3761" class="">no</st> <st data-num="3847" class="">transgression</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3761" class="">either</st>.

<st data-num="1223" class="">For</st> <st data-num="3778">this reason</st> it is <st data-num="1537">by</st> <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> <st data-num="2443" class="">so that</st> it may <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">by</st> <st data-num="5485" class="">grace</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1519">with the result that</st> the <st data-num="1860" class="">promise</st> may <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="949">certain</st> to <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="4690" class="">descendants</st>—<st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3441">only</st> to those who are <st data-num="1537">under</st> the <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>, <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> to those who have the <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st> of <st data-num="11" class="">Abraham</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="3739" class="">who</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> the <st data-num="3962" class="">father</st> of <st data-num="1473" class="">us</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">all</st>

(as it is written, “I have made you the father of many nations”). He is our father in the presence of God whom he believed—the God who makes the dead alive and summons the things that do not yet exist as though they already do.
Against hope Abraham believed in hope with the result that he became the father of many nations according to the pronouncement, “so will your descendants be.”

<st data-num="3361" class="">Without</st> being <st data-num="770" class="">weak</st> in <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st>, he <st data-num="2657" class="">considered</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1438">his own</st> <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st> as <st data-num="3499" class="">dead</st><n id="2" /> (because he <st data-num="5225" class="">was</st> <st data-num="4225" class="">about</st> <st data-num="1541">one hundred years old</st>) <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="3500" class="">deadness</st> of <st data-num="4564">Sarah’s</st> <st data-num="3388" class="">womb</st>.

He<n id="1" /> did <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1252" class="">waver</st> in <st data-num="570" class="">unbelief</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">about</st> the <st data-num="1860" class="">promise</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> was <st data-num="1743" class="">strengthened</st> in <st data-num="4102" class="">faith</st>, <st data-num="1325" class="">giving</st> <st data-num="1391" class="">glory</st> to <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>.

He was<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4135">fully convinced</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">what</st> God<n id="2" /> <st data-num="1861" class="">promised</st> he <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="1415" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="4160" class="">do</st>.
So indeed it was credited to Abraham as righteousness.
But the statement it was credited to him was not written only for Abraham’s sake,

<st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">for</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">our</st> <st data-num="1223" class="">sake</st>, to <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> it <st data-num="3195" class="">will</st> be <st data-num="3049" class="">credited</st>, those who <st data-num="4100" class="">believe</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">in</st> the one who <st data-num="1453" class="">raised</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">our</st> <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="3498" class="">dead</st>.
He was given over because of our transgressions and was raised for the sake of our justification.
